r.sample.title: Sampling
r.sample.desc: The function `sample()` in R is used to randomly select elements from a given set, with or without replacement, and with optional probabilities.
r.sample.note1: Each sample corresponds to an element of the sample space.

r.sample.more.desc: The behavior of `sample()` can be adjusted with parameters such as `replace` and `prob`.
r.sample.note2: `replace = TRUE` allows repeated sampling (sampling with replacement).
r.sample.note3: The `prob` parameter specifies the probability of each element being selected.

r.birthday.title: Birthday Probability
r.birthday.desc: We use R to compute and visualize the probability that at least two people in a group share the same birthday.
r.birthday.code:
# Function to compute the probability that at least two people 
# in a group of size n share the same birthday
birthday_prob <- function(n) {
  # Complement event: 1 - P(all birthdays distinct)
  p <- 1 - prod(1 - (0:(n - 1)) / 365)
  return(p)
}

# Compute probabilities for group sizes from 1 to 50
prob_list <- sapply(1:50, birthday_prob)

# Plot the probability curve
plot(1:50, prob_list, type = "b", pch = 19,
     xlab = "Class size (n)",
     ylab = "P(at least two share a birthday)",
     main = "Birthday Paradox")

# Add reference line at 50%
abline(h = 0.5, lty = 2, col = "gray")

# Print the first n where probability exceeds 0.5
n_threshold <- min(which(prob_list > 0.5))
cat("The probability exceeds 50% when class size is", n_threshold, "students.\n")
r.birthday.point1: `birthday_prob()` computes the probability using the complement event formula.
r.birthday.point2: `prob_list` stores probabilities for class sizes from 1 to 50.
r.birthday.point3: The plot shows the probability curve and adds a gray dashed line at 50%.
r.birthday.point4: The code prints the minimum class size where the probability exceeds 50%.
r.birthday.conclusion: Conclusion: With about 23 students in a class, the probability that at least two share a birthday already exceeds 50%.
r.birthday.caption: Probability of at least two people have the same birthday in class.
